docTitle.titlePart:
Some robust design strategies for percentile
estimation in binary response models

byline.docAuthor: Stefanie BIEDERMANN, Holger DE'TTE and Andrey PEPELYSHEV

front.keyword:
Key words and phrases: Binary response model; c-efficiency; multiobjective design; optimal design; per-
centile estimation; robustness.
MSC 2000: Primary 62K05; secondary 62J 12.
front.div:
Absrracr: For the problem of percentile estimation of a quanta1 response curve, the authors determine mul-
tiobjective designs which are robust with respect to misspecifications of the model assumptions. They
propose a maximin approach based on efficiencies which leads to designs that are simultaneously efficient
with respect to various choices of link functions and parameter regions. Furthermore, the authors deal with
the problems of designing model and percentile robust experiments. They give various examples of such
designs, which are calculated numerically.

dans les modeles de reponse binaire

fois pour divers choix de fonctions de lien et d'ensembles de valeurs pour les paramhtres. Les auteurs abor-
dent aussi la conception de modkles et de plans d'exp6rience robustes pour I'estimation des centiles. 11s
